title: Postcolonial Discourses
description: A survey of selected responses to imperialism and colonialism as presented in cultural texts produced by colonized or once-colonized peoples. Related issues to be examined: gender dynamics, class, representing others, mimicry, language, cultural theory, and the politics of literary genres. May be taken up to three times for credit when topics vary. Restricted to major code LT77 or consent of instructor and department.
